intro: Cyrtandra viridescens, commonly known as the greenish Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. Cyrtandra viridescens is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving native Hawaiian flora.
